text: Trevor Cox (born August 12, 1995) is a Canadian ice hockey player. He is currently playing in the U Sports men's ice hockey with the Alberta Golden Bears. ==Junior career== Cox began his junior career with the Medicine Hat Tigers of the Western Hockey League. During the 2014–15 WHL season, Cox led the league with 80 assists and was named to the WHL Eastern Conference First All-Star Team.Cox, Sanford named WHL All-Stars On October 28, 2015, Cox was traded to the Vancouver Giants for Clayton Kirichenko.Tigers acquire Kirichenko from Vancouver Cox later joined the Quad City Mallards of the ECHL for the latter stages of the 2015-16 ECHL season including their playoff run before moving to the University of Alberta. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1995 births Category:Living people Category:Alberta Golden Bears ice hockey players Category:Canadian ice hockey forwards Category:Ice hockey people from British Columbia Category:Medicine Hat Tigers players Category:Quad City Mallards (ECHL) players Category:Sportspeople from Surrey, British Columbia Category:Surrey Eagles players Category:Vancouver Giants players
title: Trevor Cox (ice hockey)
